function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Combining response categories may lead to loss of granularity in data and potential misrepresentation of health status.","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of health status may lead to inappropriate policy decisions and interventions based on flawed data.","Mitigation":"Use statistical techniques to analyze and interpret combined response categories, and provide context when reporting the findings.","Technologies":"Statistical analysis software, data visualization tools.","People":"Research institutions, public health agencies, policymakers.","Owner":"Researchers, data analysts, policymakers."},{"Description":"Recoding variables may introduce bias and distort the true impact of COVID-19 on individual health and well-being.","Impact":"Misleading results may affect the understanding of the pandemic's impact and the development of effective public health strategies.","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analyses to assess the impact of recoding on the results, and clearly communicate the methodology and limitations in research findings.","Technologies":"Statistical software with sensitivity analysis capabilities.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, statisticians.","Owner":"Research teams, academic institutions."}]}
